revised_title: Energy Required to Produce an Ion in Gases and the Energy of Röntgen and Becquerel Rays
tldr: The authors investigate the energy required to produce an ion in gases using X-rays and determine the energy of Röntgen and Becquerel rays. They find that the mean energy required to produce an ion in air at atmospheric pressure is 1.90 x 10^-10 erg, and the absorption of X-rays in gases is proportional to the pressure.
